page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY-STIXWOULD
page.content: Stixwould used to have a stone well in the middle of the village.The village is famous for the ghost of a lady who was crushed against an oak tree by her horse.In Stixwould there is a five pole house which is a mud building with five poles holding it up.There was an ancient church,but this was destroyed and it was many years before it was replaced by a new church.St. Peter's Church has its own graveyard. There is an abbey in Stixwould which used to have a moat to defend itself. In the moat there is a hill and on the hill is Halstead Hall.The River Witham flows near to Stixwould and there used to be a ferry across it at this point and a railway station nearby,but both ferry and railway line have now gone.
